original_definition: 'vertical load' means the total amount of power flowing out of the transmission network to the distribution networks, to directly connected final customers or to the consuming part of generation;
generated_definition: 'vertical load' means the vertical load on a structure refers to the weight of the structure itself, including any loads that are applied vertically to the structure, such as the weight of the building materials, the weight of the occupants, and any external loads such as wind or snow.

Article 2: ‘vertical load’ means the total amount of power flowing out of the transmission network to the distribution networks, to directly connected final customers or to the consuming part of generation;
